page.title: 05Blakesley Art Gallery.
page.content: The Blakesley Gallery was converted from the old barn behind the house at No 10 The Green, formerly the Greyhound pub.Its first owner,Helen Dare,was a metal sculptress who wanted to exhibit her own works but soon added those of friends and fellow artists. In 1982 it was aquired by the present proprietor, Ann Purser, who enlarged the Gallery space by bringing the upstairs section into use and also opening up an extra room.Oil paintings,water colours, prints,pottery,porcelain,glass,wood- carvings and jewellery are on show. Though local artists are always represented,other work comes from all over Britain,while the Visitors'Book records visitors to the Gallery from as far afield as America and Australia.A fresh exhibition is mounted 5 times a year,and twice a year a concert of chamber music is held.
